intro: Hesperoxiphion pusillum, commonly known as the small-flowered sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, which bloom during the summer months. Hesperoxiphion pusillum thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its botanical features make it an important component of desert ecosystems.
